title: Jovica Stokić
text:
Jovica "Joco" Stokić (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Јовица "Јоцо" Стокић; born 7 April 1987 in <a href="Grada%C4%8Dac">Gradačac</a>) is a Bosnian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er who plays for <a href="FK%20Borac%20%C5%A0amac">FK Borac Šamac</a> after a spell at <a href="FK%20Alfa">FK Alfa Modriča</a>.
Club career.
After playing 5 years with <a href="FK%20Modri%C4%8Da">FK Modriča</a> he moved abroad to Hungary in summer 2010 by signing with <a href="Nemzeti%20Bajnoks%C3%A1g%20I">Nemzeti Bajnokság I</a> side <a href="Budapest%20Honv%C3%A9d%20FC">Budapest Honvéd FC</a>. During the winter break he moved back to Bosnia to play with <a href="NK%20Zvijezda%20Grada%C4%8Dac">NK Zvijezda Gradačac</a> in the <a href="Bosnian%20Premier%20League">Bosnian Premier League</a> but next summer he moved back to Hungary this time to play with another top flight club, <a href="Kecskem%C3%A9ti%20TE">Kecskeméti TE</a>. During the winter break of the 2011-12 season he moved to Serbia to play with <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">SuperLiga</a> side <a href="FK%20BSK%20Bor%C4%8Da">FK BSK Borča</a>. In summer 2017 he left <a href="NK%20%C4%8Celik%20Zenica">Čelik Zenica</a> after spells earlier in Kuwait and with Bosnian powerhouses <a href="FK%20Borac%20Banja%20Luka">Borac Banja Luka</a> and <a href="FK%20%C5%BDeljezni%C4%8Dar%20Sarajevo">Željezničar Sarajevo</a> among others.
On 18 January 2019, Stokić joined <a href="OFK%20Sloga%20Gornje%20Crnjelovo">OFK Sloga</a>. Stokić then joined <a href="FK%20Alfa">FK Alfa Modriča</a> ahead of the 2019/20 season.
International career.
He was part of the <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Bosnian U19</a> and <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">U21</a> teams.
